hume
Class SimulationDefinition

java.lang.Object
  hume.SimulationDefinition

public class SimulationDefinition
extends java.lang.Object

The SimulationDefinition class contains all the information that is required to set up a specific simulation. The information required encompasses: The number of agents, the initial values for the agents variables, the number of agent competences, the type of interaction network, the defining parameters for the network, the type of situation (partition market or grid distance scenario), the parameters of the trust game, the type of matching algorithm and the type of learning algorithm.

Apart from storing the information about the simulation setup, the class SimulationData provides the services of verifying the correctness of the setup data, and loading and saving the simulation data.

The main reason for the introducing the class simulation data is to transfer the setup data from the input user interface to the simulation class.

STATUS: data fields as far implemented as the programming of the simulation has proceeded so far; services not yet implemented, service methods may still change (i.e. use of streams instead of filenames as parameters etc.)

Author:
eckhart

Method Detail

verify

public boolean verify()
Verifies the correctness of the data contained in this SimulationData object. Returns true, if the data does define a valid simulation.
